                    SBD and SiC MOSFET for High-Efficiency DC-DC Converter
authors: Wei Guo, Qingyuan Hua, Yucheng Gao, Shenyang Mo, Qian Wang, Jian Luo
publish: 2025 22nd China International Forum on Solid State Lighting &amp; 2025 11th International Forum on Wide Bandgap Semiconductors (SSLCHINA: IFWS)
abstract: High-performance vertical $\beta$ - Ga<inf xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">2</inf>O<inf xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">3</inf> SBD with a Schottky contact area of $1 \times 1 \mathrm{~mm}^{2}$ is demonstrated and a high-efficiency DC-DC converter is obtained based on the device. After organic and acid cleaning, the unreliable upper surface of the epitaxial layer is removed by ICP180, then the breakdown voltage is enhanced of the devices. The $\beta-\mathrm{Ga}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{3}$ SBD can obtain a forward current of 6 A with a forward voltage of 4 V, and has a reverse breakdown voltage of 610 V. The forward turn-on voltage ($V_{\mathrm{F}}$) and the on-resistance ($R_{\mathrm{on}}$) are 1.2 V and $0.47 \Omega$, respectively. The conversion efficiency of the $\beta-\mathrm{Ga}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{3}$ SBD-based DC-DC converter is 96%. This work indicates the great potential of $\beta$ - Ga<inf xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">2</inf>O<inf xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">3</inf> SBDs and relevant circuits in power electronic applications.

title: Early Detection of Bone Cancer Using Hybrid Image Processing and Deep Learning
authors: Gokul Ajay K, Hariharan L, Muheshkanna P, Senthil Kumar A
publish: 2025 Second International Conference on Intelligent Technologies for Sustainable Electric and Communications Systems (iTech SECOM)
abstract: An advanced computational framework for earlier stage of bone cancer can be detection and classified using MRI and CT scan imaging process has been proposed in this paper. Early and accurate detection of cancerous growth in knee bone is crucial for effective treatment. Deep learning techniques are used in this proposed work. Hybrid framework for cancer classification and detection using MRI and CT scan images of the knee joint is proposed in this work. pre-processing segmentation of image. Following the segmentation, feature extraction. The final stage is classification. which classifies cancerous versus noncancerous tissues from input knee bone images.Experimental analysis is carried out for disease detection accuracy, error rate and detection time compared with the proposed KFCM and conventional GCNN [1] and ARIMA [2] methods. Experimental results demonstrated superior performance over conventional approaches, achieving 98.7 % accuracy, 96.2 % sensitivity, and <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{9 5. 1 \%}$</tex> specificity and 2.5% less error rate and <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$\mathbf{1. 5} \mathbf{m s}$</tex> milliseconds less cancer detection time

title: Mathematical Modeling and Metaheuristic Optimization of IoT Task Scheduling in Distributed Flow Shop Edge Networks
authors: Achraf Sayah, Said Aqil, Mohamed Lahby
publish: 2025 12th International Conference on Wireless Networks and Mobile Communications (WINCOM)
abstract: In this paper, we address the critical challenge of scheduling IoT tasks in distributed edge computing environments. These tasks often require fast and continuous processing across multiple stages, which makes the scheduling process more complex. In order to address the problem more effectively, we model it as a Distributed Flow Shop Scheduling Problem (DFSSP) with no-wait constraints, where each task must be executed without delays between stages. The objective is to minimize the maximum tardiness, which represents the longest delay of any task beyond its due date. Because the problem is NP-hard, exact methods are not suitable for large instances. To solve it efficiently, we propose three metaheuristic approaches: Variable Neighborhood Search (VNS), a populationbased Iterated Local Search (ILS), and Iterated Greedy with Simulated Annealing (IGSA). Experimental results on benchmark instances prove the effectiveness of our approaches in reducing maximum tardiness while maintaining low computation time.

title: A Strategy of Guaranteed Information Freshness for Several Receivers Under Jamming
authors: Andrey Garnaev, Wade Trappe
publish: 2025 12th International Conference on Wireless Networks and Mobile Communications (WINCOM)
abstract: The shared and open-access nature of wireless technologies makes wireless networks susceptible to interference, such as jamming, that could lead to delays in communication and result in delays with corresponding timely information updates. Such delays in information updates can be crucial when an operator controls mobile objects since their untimely updates might lead to drastic consequences. Specifically, we consider an operator communicating with drones performing a joint mission in a protected zone. The protector (jammer) employs a spherical jamming signal to jam the communication of the operator with the drones to fail their joint mission. To design an anti-jamming strategy in such a scenario involving agents (the operator and the jammer), with different objectives, game theory is employed. Traditionally, in such a background, the anti-jamming strategy aims to minimize the total information freshness reflected by the total delay in information update. A con of such a traditional approach is that, due to limited resources, the operator might have to sacrifice the delay in information update for some drones to minimize the total delay. This could fail the joint drone mission since some drones might follow outdated commands. In this paper, motivated by this observation, we suggest using the guaranteed information freshness metric as a cost function for the operator. Under this metric, we specify the maximal time passed since the last data update for each of the drones. An anti-jamming strategy is derived, and its advantage in comparison with the minimizing total information freshness strategy is illustrated.

title: Multiple Harmonics Joint Elimination Method for Multilevel Power Amplifier
authors: Yawei Wang, Zihong Zhang, Qiaopo Xiong, Gen Long, Shaojia He, Jingsi Wang, Chao Liu
publish: 2025 International Conference on Applied Electrical Engineering and Technology (AEET)
abstract: To address the issue of significant harmonic distortion in multilevel power amplifiers, the concept of simplification through symmetric phase-shifting cancellation of multiple square waves is employed. By considering the phaseshifting angle as the unknown variable and utilizing the constraint that the coefficient of the relevant harmonic components at the eliminable harmonic frequency must be zero, a system of equations is formulated. Based on the calculated phase-shifting angles, multiple modules are utilized to implement multiple phase shifts and superposition, thereby combining to eliminate higher-order harmonics. The method proposed in this paper features straightforward control and ease of implementation, effectively minimizing low-order harmonics. Both simulation and experimental results have validated the feasibility and efficacy of the proposed combined harmonic elimination approach.

title: Research on Valve Leakage Location Detection of Shot Blasting Equipment Pipeline System
authors: Yantao An, Zhenfeng Jiang, Changhe Wang, Feng Yang, Yongzhi Pan, Xiuli Fu
publish: 2025 4th International Symposium on Sensor Technology and Control (ISSTC)
abstract: A new leakage diagnosis method of compressed gas pressure control valves is established where the fluid mass flow gradient changes are used. The method is based on the principle of conservation of mass, and it is proposed to use the gradient of mass flow and the inflection point of gradient change to leakage location. The gradient of mass flow upstream of the leakage point is greater than zero, and the gradient of mass flow downstream is less than zero, and the inflection point is leakage point. The mathematical model created to realize mass flow detection can well track the change of mass flow and reflect and monitor system flow changes accurately by experimental study. A leakage diagnosis scheme of pipeline system is designed. And a new method is applied to leakage diagnosis for the control valve inlet, outlet, cover and stem. Simulation results show that the method can get leakage types and position accurately and easily.

title: Solar-Based Load-Side Self-Healing DC Microgrid System
authors: P.I.D.T. Bala Durai Kannan, K. Ravi, A. Hema Sekhar, M Murali, S. Mallikarjunaiah, B Anil Kumar
publish: 2025 Innovations in Power and Advanced Computing Technologies (i-PACT)
abstract: This paper presents a prototype model of a DC microgrid system, incorporating cybersecurity on the source side and self-healing capabilities on the load side. The prototype has two power sources: one is a conventional source, and the other is a renewable energy source (windmill); a DC transmission line for transmitting supply from source to load; two load areas, one with an LED load and another with a motor load; and a self-active backup source. The self-active backup source has solar panels with a battery. Arduino monitors and controls all the components in this prototype. Cybersecurity on the source side frequently checks the source output against the source input. If any deviation occurs, then Arduino provides information to display units. Self-healing on the load side is done by connecting a self-active backup source with the load whenever supply from the transmission line is not available to the corresponding load area. The prototype is developed, and its various outputs under several conditions are shown. The prototype demonstrates its effectiveness by maintaining stable operation even during power fluctuations. Through real-time monitoring and adaptive control, it ensures that all components function optimally, providing a reliable energy solution for the designated load areas.

title: Micro Expression Spotting Method Based on Three Branch Fusion Network
authors: Dehao Zhang, Tao Zhang, Yanhui Tang, Haijiang Sun, Yuqing Wang, Hang Yang
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Communication and Information Systems (ICCIS)
abstract: Facial expressions, as the core carrier of nonverbal communication, can unconsciously or consciously reflect individual emotional changes and transmit multidimensional emotional signals in an instant. In the field of emotional computing, the precise spotting of micro expressions and macro expressions constitutes a key prerequisite step, with the core goal of automatically identifying the start and end time points of expressions from the original video stream, defining their duration range, and completing the classification of micro expressions and macro expressions, thus laying the data foundation for subsequent emotional state analysis and interactive applications. However, this task still faces significant technical bottlenecks: firstly, the non autonomous nature of micro expressions makes it difficult and costly to obtain their natural data; Secondly, its instantaneous nature (usually lasting 0.04-0.2 seconds) and low amplitude muscle movement characteristics not only impose strict requirements on the accuracy of manual annotation, but also directly increase the difficulty and cost of data annotation; In addition, complex lighting conditions, changes in head posture, and non-rigid facial movements can significantly reduce the model’s ability to perceive subtle facial expression changes, ultimately leading to a decrease in spotting accuracy. These challenges severely constrain the practical application of facial expression analysis technology in real-time interactive scenarios. In response to the challenges of micro expression recognition and spotting, this paper proposes a three branch micro expression spotting network based on spatiotemporal feature fusion (TFMSN). Using a fixed frame rate of micro expression intervals as pseudo labels to re label micro expression data and screen for effective apex frames. Based on the temporal characteristics of micro-expressions, a dual branch I3D network is first used to extract spatial and optical flow features of image sequences and optical flow sequences. After fusion, an LSTM network is used to enhance long-term dependency information association; In response to the subtle local changes in micro expressions, the last frame of the image sequence is used as the set peak frame input to the Swin Transformer for enhanced spatial feature representation. Finally, long short-term spatiotemporal features and global fine-grained features are fused to output the apex frame spotting result. The metric validation on the CAS (ME)<sup xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">2</sup> and SAMM datasets shows that the F1 metrics for the spotting accuracy of this method are 0.4743 and 0.4679, respectively, which are higher than other expression localization algorithms and improve the spotting ability of micro expressions.

title: AI-Assisted Model Predictive Control for Real-Time Operation of Modular Multilevel Converters Under Dynamic Load Conditions
authors: M. Shyamalagowri, M. Mohammdha Hussaini, G. Vijayagowri, D. Savitha, P. Tamilvani, S. Saravanan
publish: 2025 Innovations in Power and Advanced Computing Technologies (i-PACT)
abstract: For medium- and high-voltage applications, modular multilevel converters (MMCs) have become the topology of choice due to their modularity, scalability, and overall superior harmonic performance. However, the typical Model Predictive Control (MPC) approaches can poorly control MMCs due to the intricate characteristics in their multi-variable dynamics, especially while load conditions are quickly changing. Additionally, these approaches often have inaccurate models in real-time applications with a higher computational burden. This research proposes an AI-assisted MPC paradigm that enhances performance for prediction and control of an MMC within dynamic environments, to overcome these limitations. The central contribution is the addition of a prediction model based on a neural network to the MPC loop. Since it is a neural network, it has the power to predict the states of the system accurately and in real-time, while also having less computational latency because it can be trained structure-offline with large populations of MMC operational scenarios. This prediction model assists the MPC in generating the optimal control signals to minimize a cost function considering switching losses, arm current deviations, and capacitor voltage imbalance. A comprehensive MMC model is developed and implemented in a Hardware-in-theLoop (HIL) simulation set-up using the OPAL-RT real-time simulator. The proposed control framework was evaluated in multiple situations including sudden load shifts and faults. The AI-assisted MPC was found to: better dynamic response time 30%, reduce total harmonic distortion (THD) from 6.2 % to 3.4% and keep the capacitor voltage balancing within a 5% tolerance based on comparative analyses. The results show that the real-time operation performance and robustness of MMC operation is significantly improved when AI prediction is integrated in the MPC scheme. This study sets the stage for implementing intelligent predictive control in future highvoltage direct current (HVDC) and smart grid systems.

title: Credit Card Fraud Detection Model Based on Explainable Tabnet-Based Feature Selection
authors: Karima El Hachimi, Ghizlane Orhanou, Lahoucine Ballihi
publish: 2025 12th International Conference on Wireless Networks and Mobile Communications (WINCOM)
abstract: Financial losses and sensitive data breaches are the most popular risks of credit card fraud in this modern society. Advanced deep learning algorithms have shown outstanding performance regarding fraud detection in this field. However, the proposed models still suffer from the imbalance class problem and the high rate of false positives and negatives. To overcome these challenges, we introduce in this paper a new approach based on TabNet-based feature selection and sequential hybridization of Random Forest and optimized deep learning algorithm. This model outperformed its rivals in detecting complex fraudulent patterns with confidence while minimizing false negatives. Our powerful performance is achieved by combining TabNet feature selection, outlier removal using Z -score and IQR, and strong classification of Random Forest-Deep Learning. The imbalance issue was handled using random oversampling. The results of the experiment demonstrated that our model achieved 100% accuracy, 100% precision, and 1.00 recall regardless of the dataset used which proved its generalization.

title: Low-Cost Image Processing-Based Teleoperated Robotic Arm for Remote Surgical Assistance and Digital Health Integration
authors: Ali Bostani
publish: 2025 IEEE 18th International Symposium on Embedded Multicore/Many-core Systems-on-Chip (MCSoC)
abstract: Remote surgery promises to expand access to specialist care, yet current robotic systems remain expensive and rely on proprietary hardware and wearable sensors. We present a low-cost, image processing-based teleoperation system that replicates operator arm and hand movements on a 4-DOF robotic arm over a wireless link. Using a conventional USB camera and the MediaPipe framework for robust, sensorless hand and pose tracking, joint angles and gripper commands are computed in real time and transmitted via 2.4GHz Wi-Fi to an ESP32-C3 Mini module that relays commands to an Arduino Nano for PWM actuation. Across repeated trials under typical indoor lighting and network conditions, end-to-end response remained within 500 ms while reproducing static postures and dynamic trajectories with smooth servo motion and reliable grasp/release behavior. The architecture emphasizes a clean separation of perception, transport, and actuation, and adopts IEEE-aligned practices (requirements specification, software testing, environmental considerations). We discuss limitations (lighting, lack of haptics, Wi-Fi variability), safety measures, and future work, and outline integration under study with a digital-health platform to enable secure tele-mentoring and training.

title: Next-Generation Smart Waste Bins: Iot-Based Waste Monitoring and Collection Optimization
authors: Adit Garg, Madan Gopal Jha, Vinayaka Saxena, Diksha Chawla, Anupama Padha
publish: 2025 Seventeenth International Conference on Contemporary Computing (IC3)
abstract: IoT-Enabled Waste Monitoring and Collection Enhancement overcome major shortcomings in innovative city waste management systems. In our work, we proposed an IoT-enabled system that provides real-time monitoring of waste levels through sensors. Our work covers the route collection using the Capacitated Vehicle Routing Problem (CVRP) algorithm. Our method offers an innovative approach that benefits a smart city by preventing bins from overflowing, reducing fuel consumption, and lowering overall operating costs. The initiative enhances urban cleanliness through IoT and advanced computational methods while supporting sustainability objectives by minimizing environmental impact. Our work offers an intuitive platform for academicians and researchers to organize effective routes, and verify waste collection timelines. The initiative establishes a standard for contemporary, environmentally sustainable waste management methods

title: Research on Bidirectional TCM Control Strategy for Totem-Pole AC/DC Converters
authors: Wenlong Zhao, Chunguang Ren, Qiaozhi Xue
publish: 2025 International Conference on Applied Electrical Engineering and Technology (AEET)
abstract: A hysteresis current control strategy is proposed in this paper to address the complexities of bidirectional power control and efficiency limitations in single-phase AC/DC converters. The junction capacitance of Gallium-Nitride (GaN) transistor and the resonance of power inductors are utilized in this strategy to achieve zero-voltage-switching (ZVS) of power switches. Controlling the peak values of the forward and reverse currents of the hysteresis current enables the converter to achieve full-range ZVS in triangular current mode (TCM). The totem-pole AC/DC converter achieves ZVS and functions as a rectifier with power factor correction capability when using the proposed control strategy. It can also operate in inversion mode to feed energy back into the grid. A SIMPLIS simulation model was built to validate the rationale behind the parameter design and verify the effectiveness of the control method in both rectification and inversion modes.

title: Design of Dual-Loop Model Predictive Control for Grid-Forming Inverters
authors: Nottakorn Sukmanont, Kanet Katchasuwanmanee, Thongchart Kerdphol
publish: 2025 IEEE PES GTD Grand International Conference and Exposition Asia (GTD Asia)
abstract: The most prominent technology is the grid-forming inverter (GFMI) concept. This technology enables the full potential of renewable energy to be harnessed, forming an electrical grid without relying on traditional generators. However, a significant challenge lies in the efficiency of its control systems. Conventional PI control methods often result in suboptimal power efficiency when integrating renewable energy, especially under fluctuating power conditions, making them less suitable for standalone renewable systems. To address this issue, this paper introduces a dual-loop model predictive control (DMPC) strategy, explicitly divided into voltage and current control loops to simplify control, enhance stability, and improve overall performance. This approach allows the system to deliver power more accurately to the desired set-points, significantly reducing overshoot and accelerating recovery times in transient responses. Test results demonstrate that DMPC outperforms conventional PI control in both transient and steady-state performance, achieving stable voltage, current, and frequency regulation. Additionally, the proposed method was evaluated under fault conditions, islanding mode, and load shedding, clearly illustrating its superior performance across various challenging scenarios.

title: Design and Power-Efficiency Analysis of FPGA-Based Dot and Outer Product Units
authors: Kyoji Awaki, Yoichi Tomioka, Yuichi Okuyama, Hiroshi Saito, Shogo Semba, Stanislav Sedukhin, Yuta Takahashi, Sumio Morioka
publish: 2025 IEEE 18th International Symposium on Embedded Multicore/Many-core Systems-on-Chip (MCSoC)
abstract: In power-constrained edge computing environments such as small satellites, energy-efficient inference of convolutional neural networks (CNNs) is crucial. This paper presents a comprehensive design and evaluation of dot-product units (DPUs) and outer-product units (OPUs) implemented on an FPGA device, targeting multiply-and-accumulate (MAC)-dominated workloads in CNNs. We investigate the trade-offs between inference time, energy consumption, hardware resource utilization, and the energy-delay product (EDP) across a range of vector sizes, array configurations, and clock frequencies. Our evaluation reveals that DPU architectures offer superior EDP performance through pipelining and efficient scaling with vector size. Furthermore, we show that model architecture, such as switching from VGG19 to ResNet-18, significantly impacts energy efficiency. Specifically, we provide a systematic comparison of DPU and OPU architectures under various parallelism and clock configurations in terms of latency, energy, and EDP. We also present realistic FPGA implementations using accurate power models to evaluate energy and resource efficiency. Finally, we quantify how CNN architecture design choices, particularly the use of ResNet-18 over VGG19, affect overall energy efficiency. These findings offer practical design guidelines for deploying AI accelerators in ultra-low-power environments by balancing architectural parallelism and hardware constraints.

title: A Multi-Scale Wavelet-Based Algorithm for Gas Chromatographic Peak Identification
authors: Jiaxing Guo, Haohua Qin, Yuteng Zhang, Lantian Guo, Yang Li
publish: 2025 4th International Symposium on Sensor Technology and Control (ISSTC)
abstract: To address the challenges of low accuracy in overlapping peak identification and strong spike interference in portable gas chromatographs, this paper proposes a chromatographic peak detection algorithm based on multi-scale wavelet decomposition (MSWC-PD). By introducing a multi-scale wavelet approximation coefficient enhancement mechanism, the algorithm improves responsiveness to peak features. A weighted clustering strategy integrating scale factors and peak prominence is designed to extract optimal peak positions from multi-scale candidate peaks, enhancing the accuracy of overlapping peak localization. A wavelet energy ratio model is constructed using both detail and approximation coefficients to enable the identification and dynamic removal of anomalous spikes. Simulation results demonstrate that the MSWC-PD method outperforms the conventional wavelet method in terms of peak identification completeness, false detection suppression, and robustness against spike interference, highlighting its strong robustness and practical applicability.

title: A Comprehensive Study on Execution Right Delegation Scheduling Algorithm for Multiprocessors
authors: Takaharu Suzuki, Kiyofumi Tanaka
publish: 2025 IEEE 18th International Symposium on Embedded Multicore/Many-core Systems-on-Chip (MCSoC)
abstract: In scheduling algorithms based on the Rate Monotonic method, tasks with shorter periods have higher priorities, whereas those with longer periods tend to suffer from increased response times and jitters. To address this issue, we previously proposed the Execution Right Delegation (ERD) scheduling algorithm, which introduces a high-priority server for privileged tasks. While our earlier work demonstrated the feasibility of ERD with a single privileged task on a small-scale multiprocessor system, the approach remained limited in scope. In this paper, we present a comprehensive study of the ERD scheduling algorithm for multiprocessors. We extend the algorithm to support an arbitrary number of privileged tasks, up to the number of available processors, thereby generalizing the original framework. Furthermore, we conduct an extensive experimental evaluation on systems with up to 32 processors, examining response times, jitters, and schedulability under diverse workloads. The results show that the extended ERD algorithm improves the response times of privileged tasks compared with conventional partitioned Fixed-Task-Priority scheduling, while also revealing trade-offs in jitter characteristics.

title: Feature Enhancement and Selective Attention Detection Transformer for UAV Small Object Detection
authors: Boyang Zhang, Liming Sun, Baolin Su, Xinyang Liu
publish: 2025 6th International Conference on Computer Engineering and Intelligent Control (ICCEIC)
abstract: Small object detection in unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) imagery has become increasingly important in diverse applications such as precision agriculture, power line inspection, and search-and-rescue operations. Nevertheless, UAV images present substantial challenges including inadequate feature representation due to receptive field mismatch, difficulties in preserving edge information leading to poor target-background discrimination, and insufficient cross-scale feature fusion. To address these limitations, we propose FESA-DETR, an enhanced small object detection algorithm. First, we design the Contextual Adaptive Learning Block (CALBlock) feature extraction module, which integrates local contextual information with global feature representations through local contextual perception, adaptive attention mechanism, and feature gating unit, effectively improving the feature expression capability for small objects. Second, we introduce the Edge-enhanced Multiscale Information Transfer (EMIT) architecture, employing multiscale edge feature extraction and adaptive fusion to significantly enhance the model's perception of small object edge contours in complex backgrounds. Finally, we develop the Feature Selective Attention Feature Pyramid Network (FSAFPN), utilizing spatial dimension decomposition attention mechanisms and adaptive feature selection strategies to achieve efficient cross-scale feature integration and enhancement. Compared to the baseline RT-DETR-R18 model, FESA-DETR achieves improvements of 2.1%, 3.2%, and 1.6% in AP, AP50, and APs metrics respectively on the VisDrone2019 dataset. Experimental results demonstrate the effectiveness and significant advancement of our proposed method in UAV small object detection.

title: Analysis of Feature Extraction Techniques on Various Signal and Image Attacks
authors: Rizee P J, Jasmine Pemeena Priyadarisini M, Anuradha T, Kishore Bingi, Bharghav M, Sreekanth Reddy Y, Swami Sai K, Sweta Sarita Sarangi
publish: 2025 Innovations in Power and Advanced Computing Technologies (i-PACT)
abstract: This paper presents a comparative evaluation of three advanced feature extraction algorithms: Speeded-Up Robust Features (SURF), Binary Robust Invariant Scalable Keypoints (BRISK), and Histogram of Oriented Gradients (HOG), to assess their effectiveness in the presence of multi-image and signal-level adversarial conditions. The study focuses on the resilience of these techniques when applied to images affected by a range of distortions, including both noise-induced degradation and geometric transformations. The experimental framework incorporates feature extraction and matching, followed by a quantitative similarity assessment using Hausdorff Distance Analysis to evaluate the correspondence between original and perturbed image sets. The noise models under consideration include Salt-and-Pepper, Speckle, and Gaussian noise, while the geometric transformations involve Rotation, Compression, and Translation, collectively referred to as RCT-based attacks. Results indicate that SURF demonstrates moderate robustness across most distortion types, providing a balanced trade-off between feature stability and discriminative capacity. BRISK exhibits higher sensitivity to Gaussian noise but maintains computational efficiency. In contrast, HOG effectively captures structural and edge-based characteristics, although its performance in feature matching under noise conditions is relatively constrained. The Hausdorff distance analysis further reveals that Gaussian noise results in the most significant degradation of feature matching accuracy, particularly affecting both SURF and BRISK descriptors.

title: Secure and Robust Medical Report Verification Using DCT-Based Steganography with Patient ID
authors: Saniel Bhattarai, Riya Vaid, Vetriselvi T
publish: 2025 Innovations in Power and Advanced Computing Technologies (i-PACT)
abstract: In the area of health care, total accuracy and security of medical records form the very essence. Report management errors that are occurring whether due to human mistakes or less powerful verifications ystems may lead t over y serious consequences, including misdiagnosis or wrong treatment. Many systems focus on providing storage and retrieval functions; however, they very rarely provide strong mechanisms of verifying the ownership of reports considering the modern handicaps faced by data regarding compression and deliberately tampered files. Previous works on image steganography and data compression have generally dealt with generic security concerns while leaving a gap in addressing healthcare-sharing needs. This paper describes an advanced Discrete Cosine Transform (DCT) based approach in terms of the enhancement of reliability and security in the verification of medical reports. Patient metadata are embedded in DCT low and mid-frequency coefficients of medical images such as X-rays or CT scans. It is ensured during lossy compression, using, for example, JPEG, that the data remains intact without degradation in image quality, thus protecting sensitive information from being disclosed while overcoming much of the limitations of existing techniques. This solution effortlessly connects with hospital systems to automate report verification and retrieval, cutting down on errors and giving patients greater peace of mind. It streamlines the secure and efficient management of medical records, meeting a crucial need in today's healthcare world.

title: Towards Transparent Plant Disease Detection: Applying XAI to Deep Learning Models in Precision Agriculture
authors: Anoushka Duggal, Vasu Chugh, Jyoti Maggu
publish: 2025 Seventeenth International Conference on Contemporary Computing (IC3)
abstract: Plant disease detection is a critical part of ensuring healthy crops and maintaining high yields. Traditionally, this has relied on manual inspections, which are time-consuming and can be prone to errors. However, with the rise of machine learning and deep learning technologies, we now have the opportunity to automate this process, making it faster and more accurate. Despite their impressive performance, these models are often seen as “black boxes,” where the decision-making process is unclear, which makes it difficult for farmers and agronomists to trust them fully. We address this issue by introducing LIME, Captum, and Global Surrogate, methods that help make deep learning models more understandable. We tested several models, including VGG11, VGG16, ViT-Base-Patch16, InceptionV3, and a Custom CNN, using a variety of plant disease images. While models like InceptionV3 performed the best in terms of accuracy, the Custom CNN was able to match its performance while being more efficient in terms of computation. By visualizing which parts of the plant images were most important in making a diagnosis, we made the process much clearer and easier to understand. This study shows that not only can AI-driven tools be accurate, but they can also be transparent, providing farmers with both trustworthy predictions and a clear understanding of how those predictions are made.

title: Sparse Iterative Solvers Using High-Precision Arithmetic with Quasi Multi-Word Algorithms
authors: Daichi Mukunoki, Katsuhisa Ozaki
publish: 2025 IEEE 18th International Symposium on Embedded Multicore/Many-core Systems-on-Chip (MCSoC)
abstract: To obtain accurate results in numerical computation, high-precision arithmetic is a straightforward approach. However, most processors lack hardware support for floating-point formats beyond double precision (FP64). Double-word arithmetic (Dekker 1971) extends precision by using standard floating-point operations to represent numbers with twice the mantissa length. Building on this concept, various multi-word arithmetic methods have been proposed to further increase precision by combining additional words. Simplified variants, known as quasi algorithms, have also been introduced, trading a certain loss of accuracy for reduced computational cost. This study investigates the performance of quasi algorithms for double- and triple-word arithmetic in sparse iterative solvers based on the Conjugate Gradient method, comparing them with both non-quasi algorithms and standard FP64. We evaluate execution time on an x86 processor, iteration count to convergence, and solution accuracy. Although quasi algorithms require appropriate normalization to preserve accuracy - without it, convergence cannot be achieved - they can still reduce runtime when normalization is applied correctly, while maintaining accuracy comparable to full multi-word algorithms. In particular, quasi triple-word arithmetic yields more accurate solutions without significantly increasing execution time relative to double-word arithmetic and its quasi variant. Furthermore, for certain problems, a reduction in iteration count contributes to additional speedup. Thus, quasi triple-word arithmetic can serve as a compelling alternative to conventional double-word arithmetic in sparse iterative solvers.

title: The MediaPot Platform for News Analytics
authors: Elisavet Palogiannidi, Sotiris Legkas, Dimitrios Vogiatzis, Vasiliki Koutsoupia, Manolis Mylonas, Vasileios Mezaris, Spyridoula Markou, George Zissis, Pantelis Theodosiou
publish: 2025 20th International Workshop on Semantic and Social Media Adaptation and Personalization (SMAP)
abstract: The MediaPot platform aims to offer news and social media analytics tools so that will facilitate the work journalists, and in particular to report on stories based on their interests. Thus, it comprises tools for text and video analytics. In particular, it builds on tools for question answering systems on social media and news articles, as well as on the creation of a network that captures the entities and the relations that are involved in a story. On the multimedia side it offers video summarization to allow journalists to build a story based on the highlights of a video. Second, it provides recognition capabilities to identify i Finally, we describe the software architecture that connect all the diverse components and present some early evaluation results.

title: Weather-Aware Solar Energy Forecasting Using Hybrid ARIMA-LSTM Model
authors: Nemali Ashrith Reddy, Akshay Reddy Velugati, Kiran P
publish: 2025 Seventeenth International Conference on Contemporary Computing (IC3)
abstract: Solar energy forecasting presents a critical component for maximizing the utilization of energy from renewable sources, but it remains unclear whether the role that Atmospheric variability plays, as well as solar variability, affects forecasting accuracy. This study examines a novel hybrid method that merges the Autoregressive Integrated Moving Average (ARIMA) and Long Short-Term Memory architecture (LSTM) networks using currently available meteorological information to improve solar output forecasting in Kerala, India. The ARIMA draws on historical solar data to extract linear patterns. The LSTM attempts to represent complex, non-linear relationships and temporality in the data. Moreover, currently available meteorological conditions are integrated into each instance of the forecast, such as temperature, relative humidity, precipitation, and wind speed, to incorporate the wider external factors associated with solar production for Kerala's tropical climate. The hybrid method was applied to actual data from five years, 2020-2025, on solar data from Kerala to yield a 42% reduction in Mean Absolute Percentage Error (MAPE) compared against both standalone ARIMA and LSTM methods. This work indicates the merit of hybrid models in combining currently available weather information to improve forecasting accuracy, leading to important considerations for the uptake of renewable energy sources in regions such as Kerala that face inconsistent climatic weather variability.

title: EYE-DEX: Eye Disease Detection and EXplanation System
authors: Youssef Sabiri, Walid Houmaidi, Amine Abouaomar
publish: 2025 12th International Conference on Wireless Networks and Mobile Communications (WINCOM)
abstract: Retinal disease diagnosis is critical in preventing vision loss and reducing socioeconomic burdens. Globally, over 2.2 billion people are affected by some form of vision impairment, resulting in annual productivity losses estimated at $411 billion. Traditional manual grading of retinal fundus images by ophthalmologists is time-consuming and subjective. In contrast, deep learning has revolutionized medical diagnostics by automating retinal image analysis and achieving expert-level performance. In this study, we present EYE-DEX, an automated framework for classifying 10 retinal conditions using the large-scale Retinal Disease Dataset comprising 21,577 eye fundus images. We benchmark three pre-trained Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) models—VGG16, VGG19, and ResNet50—with our fine-tuned VGG16 achieving a state-of-the-art global benchmark test accuracy of 92.36 %. To enhance transparency and explainability, we integrate the Gradient-weighted Class Activation Mapping (Grad-CAM) technique to generate visual explanations highlighting disease-specific regions, thereby fostering clinician trust and reliability in AI-assisted diagnostics.

title: Glint: Localization of Gray Violations in Untrusted and Unreliable SRv6 Networks
authors: Kaiyang Zhao, Han Zhang, Yahui Li, Xingang Shi, Zhiliang Wang, Xia Yin, Jiankun Hu, Jianping Wu
publish: IEEE Transactions on Information Forensics and Security
abstract: In the Segment Routing over IPv6 (SRv6) network, a wide range of network events (e.g., attacks, intrusions, violations, malicious route announcements) may occur. Network management requires real-time monitoring of untrusted and unreliable environments (e.g., unsafe components and devices). Early localization of abnormal links causing violations in the SRv6 network helps minimize the compensation required for service unavailability. However, the overhead of the state-of-the-art methods does not scale efficiently to large-scale SRv6 networks and exhibit poor robustness to addressing various disturbances from unreliable networks. To cope with these challenges, we propose Glint, an in-band network telemetry framework to localize abnormal links in SRv6 networks. The key idea of Glint is sampling part of the information while the overall information is known. Glint provides probabilistic in-band collection to gather segment-level telemetry data, reducing overhead and improving efficiency. Glint also proposes distributed verification-based detection to enhance the trustworthiness of security assessments, further improving robustness against disturbances. In addition, we design selective telemetry that reduces telemetry reports while preserving security-relevant visibility. Our evaluations demonstrate that, compared to the state-of-the-art frameworks, Glint significantly reduces header bandwidth overhead by 75.6% and memory overhead by 48.7% while reducing false positives. We also implement Glint on the Intel Tofino switch, achieving over a 50% reduction in hardware resource consumption compared to existing methods.

title: The Interplay Between Strategic Information Sharing and Quality Decision: Pre-quality Versus Post-quality
authors: Futou Li, Yongjian Li, Wei Wang
publish: IEEE Transactions on Engineering Management
abstract: This paper examines the interplay between the retailer's strategic information sharing and the manufacturer's quality decisions under two decision sequences: pre-quality and post-quality scenarios. We analyze the retailer's ex-post information sharing policy (deciding how to share the obtained demand information) under both sequences, discuss the impact of decision sequences on the quality level, and explore the preferences of supply chain participants for pre- and post-quality scenarios. The key findings are as follows: In the post-quality scenario, if consumers have high quality sensitivity, the retailer tends to share high-demand information but conceal low-demand information; otherwise, the result is just the opposite. Conversely, in the pre-quality scenario, the retailer consistently shares low-demand information but conceals high-demand information. Notably, whether in the pre-quality or post-quality scenario, an intriguing phenomenon may emerge, that is, the retailer may experience a counterintuitive increase in profit as the expected information cost rises. The outcomes of quality levels in pre- and post-quality scenarios depend on the information status obtained by the retailer and the consumers' quality sensitivity. Interestingly, the retailer consistently prefers the post-quality scenario, while the manufacturer may prefer the pre-quality scenario under certain conditions. Finally, our findings remain relatively robust when considering imperfect information acquisition or a general demand distribution.

title: Visual Interference Suppression for Physical Object Detection in Projector-based AR System_supp2-3649703.mp4
authors: JUNGHAN KWON
publish: N/A
abstract: Projector-based Augmented Reality (AR) provides intuitive guidance by projecting virtual content directly onto a physical workspace. However, when projected images overlap real objects, they distort the camera view, and detection accuracy drops for models like MediaPipe and YOLO. Moreover, a phenomenon known as ‘Visual Echo’, situation that system mistakes bright projected shapes as real objects, can occur. In addition, the projector-camera response is highly non-linear, which makes simple real-time correction difficult. To overcome these issues, we present a two-stage image preprocessing algorithm designed to suppress projection interference. Our method combines Color Refinement based on a Color Transformation Table and masked Lightness Compensation to effectively remove projection artifacts and enhance the visibility of physical objects. Experimental results show that the algorithm significantly reduces positional error by 70.47% and instability by 70.17% in MediaPipe hand landmark detection, while achieving 100% correct detection rate and reducing positional error by 86.32% in YOLOv8 object detection by effectively eliminating visual echoes. Furthermore, our algorithm maintains real-time performance at 27.4 FPS, making it suitable for practical applications. We successfully demonstrate the robust performance of our method through three distinct use cases: AR-based virtual ring try-on, dining etiquette education, and assembly training, highlighting its potential to enhance the reliability of projector-based AR systems across various fields.

title: A Unified Framework for Joint Optimization of Fluid Antenna Systems and Low-Resolution RIS/STAR-RIS in MU-MISO Downlink
authors: Jung-Chieh Chen, Tai-Jung Lee
publish: IEEE Internet of Things Journal
abstract: In this paper, we propose a novel framework that integrates fluid antenna systems (FASs) with reconfigurable intelligent surfaces (RISs) to enhance the performance of multiuser multiple-input single-output (MU-MISO) downlink systems. Unlike conventional approaches that assume continuous fluid antenna (FA) mobility and rely exclusively on passive reflective RISs, the proposed design addresses practical constraints by: (i) incorporating discrete FA positioning to accommodate hardware limitations; (ii) utilizing irregular RIS configurations with low-resolution phase shifts to enhance channel diversity; and (iii) deploying irregular, low-resolution simultaneous transmitting and reflecting RISs (STAR-RISs) to achieve full-space signal coverage. A unified optimization framework is developed to jointly design the transmit beamforming vectors, discrete FA positions, and RIS/STAR-RIS coefficients. The proposed solution combines regularized zero-forcing (RZF) precoding with a probabilistic learning mechanism based on the cross-entropy optimization method. Simulation results reveal that the proposed architecture significantly outperforms conventional fixed-antenna systems and purely reflective RIS configurations, leading to substantial gains in sum-rate performance.

title: GrowSphere: Intelligent Hydroponic System for Effortless Cultivation of Leafy Vegetables
authors: Vishmina Obeysekara, Thilini A. Perera, L. N. C. De Silva, K. D. Sandaruwan
publish: IEEE Access
abstract: The rising global population and rapid urbanization have increased the demand for food, with many people now living in apartments and leading busy lifestyles that limit their ability to grow plants. Indoor hydroponic cultivation has emerged as a promising solution, offering higher productivity and more efficient use of resources. However, growing and maintaining plants indoors can still be challenging. To address this, we designed and implemented a self-maintaining, IoT-enabled smart pot called “GrowSphere” for the indoor cultivation of peppermint, aimed at minimizing human intervention and optimizing growth conditions. The system architecture integrates an Arduino microcontroller with multiple sensors, and environmental data are continuously collected through pH, electrical conductivity, and water-level sensors. The system automatically regulates nutrient levels, water supply, and LED light spectra to maintain optimal growth conditions. In addition, GrowSphere supports remote monitoring, data analysis, and prediction of growth patterns. Compared to traditional soil and Deep Water Culture (DWC) hydroponic methods, the proposed approach demonstrates enhanced plant growth rates and yield quality, while reducing labor, water, and energy requirements. Plants grown in the GrowSphere achieved the highest fresh weight (11.0 ± 1.5 g), with some reaching up to 12.5 g. In contrast, DWC hydroponics (1.2±0.3 g) and soil cultivation (0.9±0.4 g) produced significantly lower weights. The proposed system was developed at a cost of approximately USD 268 and built using open-source software, offering a low-cost, sustainable, and high-performance solution for urban plant cultivation.

title:
Demonstration of a MgB

                    DC-DC boost converter for ultra-fast battery charge up to 200 A - 200 V output power
authors: T. Yagai, Y. Makida, T. Shintomi, N. Hirano, T. Hamajima
publish: IEEE Transactions on Applied Superconductivity
abstract: Liquid hydrogen (LH<sub xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">2</sub>) is one of the most attractive energy storage media because of its high energy-mass density. Using the cold energy of LH<sub xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">2</sub> to cool the superconducting inductor (SCI) installed in the DCDC converter would shorten the charging time of battery electric vehicles (BEVs) owing to its very large current capacity and around 98% conversion efficiency, disregarding cryogenic cooling inefficiency as well. Designing the converter with SCI leads to a reduced number of circuit components and contributes to higher efficiency compared to conventional 95% in ultra-fast charger circuits for BEVs. A MgB 2 SCI used converter maintains very high efficiency at an output power of 30 kW, at a 200 V doubly-boosted 100 V input voltage. A higher gain converter is also demonstrated with two Bi2223 SCIs, showing wide range gain control, which would lead to high voltage and large current capacity optimal for ultra-fast charges for BEVs.

title: IE-TV: Structural Information Enhanced 3D Weighted Correlated Total Variation for Hyperspectral Image Denoising
authors: Ke Yang, Long Yu, Fan Li, Jia Chen, Zhaozhao Zeng, Jun Li, Antonio Plaza
publish: IEEE Journal of Selected Topics in Applied Earth Observations and Remote Sensing
abstract: Hyperspectral image (HSI) denoising remains challenging due to the difficulty in recovering the complex structure in HSIs under the corruption of mixed-noise. Existing methods face two key limitations: 1) they ignore the underlying structural information, thus failing to preserve fine textures while smoothing the global structure, leading to the appearance of staircase artifacts or over-smoothing on spatial details; 2) the TV regularization overlooks the mixed differences of noise across three dimensions of HSI, thereby exacerbating the spectral over-smoothing and causing spectral distortion. To address these issues, we propose a structural information enhanced three-dimensional weighted correlated total variation (IE-TV) method for HSI denoising. We first construct a weighted CTV (WCTV) regularization term to adaptively adjust the smoothness constraints on different dimensions according to the noise characteristics. Furthermore, our IE-TV framework learns a structural information enhancement matrix at a more refined scale, which is then utilized to impose constraints on the gradient nuclear norm in WCTV. By solving this new optimization problem, IE-TV achieves a balance between the preservation of details (such as edges and textures) and the restoration of the global structure (such as spectral continuity). Experimental verifications on three HSI datasets show that IE-TV outperforms state-of-the-art methods in terms of both visual quality and quantitative indicators (PSNR, SSIM, ERGAS), reducing over-smoothing while maintaining fine structures and spectral consistency.

title: Global Entity Relationship Enhancement Network for Multimodal Sarcasm Detection
authors: Xiaobao Wang, Meng Ge, Lingshan Li, Di Jin, Kai He, Erik Cambria
publish: IEEE Transactions on Affective Computing
abstract: Sarcasm functions as a distinct mode of communication, intended to convey a meaning contrary to its literal interpretation. With the rapid proliferation of social networks, various manifestations of multimodal sarcasm have become widespread. Consequently, there is a growing emphasis on discerning sarcasm conveyed through multimodal data. Existing research often provides only a superficial interpretation of images, lacking a thorough exploration of the contextual nuances embedded within, particularly in understanding the scene depicted in the image. In this paper, we aim to delve deeper into the information embedded within images. Specifically, we begin by extracting entity relationships from images to capture the contextual information they convey. Additionally, we utilize image text recognition to extract textual information from the images. After conducting a comprehensive analysis of the image information, we establish consistency modeling between the image content and text using external knowledge. Finally, we employ a graph neural network to process the constructed cross-modal graph and make predictions regarding sarcasm. Extensive experiments validate the state-of-the-art performance of our model on publicly available multimodal Twitter datasets.

title: iAKA: A Regional Authentication Protocol for Satellite Internet
authors: Lai Renwei, Wang Xiaofeng, Xing Qianqian, Wang Shanfeng
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Communication and Information Systems (ICCIS)
abstract: Traditional satellite internet mostly uses a centralized authentication system, which has issues like long authentication links and many interactions, making it vulnerable to authentication link blocking attacks. This paper presents a lightweight iAKA authentication protocol. Its distributed regional core network (ACN) deployment shortens the user-authentication network element path. The regional authentication key technology based on identity-based cryptography enables end-to end authentication key self-organization between LEO satellites and ACNs and between users and ACNs, solving the pre-shared symmetric key dependence in centralized authentication. Also, it reduces authentication interactions to three steps for completing authentication and key negotiation. The protocol has security features like mutual authentication and man-in-the-middle attack resistance, and strengthens user identifier anonymous transmission. Experiments show that compared with other protocols, the iAKA protocol has lower computational time overhead, is more LEO-resource-friendly with low computational and storage demands, suits LEO’s resource-constrained environment, and reduces overall transmission bandwidth by $25.2 \%$.

title: Quantum-Resilient Proxy-Re-encryption-Based Homomorphic Encryption Using Nth Order Binary Encoding (NOBE) for NextG networks
authors: Bharat S. Rawal
publish: 2025 Seventeenth International Conference on Contemporary Computing (IC3)
abstract: Six generation(6G) wireless technology provides better coverage, lower energy consumption and improve security all while being cost-effective. 6G network provided platform for newer technologies like multiple access methods, advanced methods for designs, channel coating network slicing various antennas, technologies, and cloud -edge computing and artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) models. The explosive use of AI and large language models (LLM) raised concerns about data privacy and security. To overcome privacy concerns researchers and practitioners have started widely employing federated learning methods. The fully homo morphic encryption (FHE) is the underlying mechanism for the success of federated learning techniques. FHE suffers from significant limitations ciphertext expansion leads to slower data transmission and processing speeds, and increased storage requirements. Furthermore, as a newer encryption scheme, HE’s widespread adoption is limited, increasing the risk of undiscovered vulnerabilities. This paper discusses the security challenges with 5G and next Generation wireless networks. By leveraging NOBE, we propose framework not only enhances security but also facilitates advanced data processing capabilities without compromising user privacy. The findings underscore the potential of integrating quantum-resilient encryption techniques in future network architectures, paving the way for safer and more reliable communication systems. Additionally, this paper explores ways to mitigate the challenges of ciphertext expansion and processing delays associated with homomorphic encryption (HE).

title: Neural Machine Translation for Cross-Language Robotics Programming Education
authors: Farkhod Eliboev, Zilola Sattorova, Nigora Yadgarova, Nafosat Urokova, Mavlonjon Abdusamatov, Makhfuza Babayeva
publish: 2025 Second International Conference on Intelligent Technologies for Sustainable Electric and Communications Systems (iTech SECOM)
abstract: Robotics programming education is expanding globally, where students and instructors often engage with learning resources, tutorials, and programming exercises written in multiple languages. While this opens access to diverse knowledge sources, the lack of standardized cross-language instructional material hinders effective learning and collaboration in programming environments. Language barriers create inconsistencies in understanding algorithms, control logic, and domain-specific robotics terminology, particularly when nonnative learners work with technical code documentation or tutorials available only in English. To address this limitation, the paper propose a Neural Machine Translation for Robotics Education Framework (NMTRF), which leverages transformer-based neural machine translation models fine-tuned on domain-specific robotics programming corpora. The framework is designed to handle technical terminology, code-comment translations, and dual-mode educational materials, ensuring semantic accuracy and pedagogical clarity across languages. NMTRF integrates context-aware translation modules with preannotated robotics datasets, thereby delivering accurate translations for both textual instructions and embedded code explanations. Experiments conducted on multilingual robotics courseware and online repositories demonstrated that NMTRF achieved a BLEU score improvement of 14% over baseline NMT systems while reducing terminology mistranslations by 21%. Furthermore, student comprehension assessments indicated significant learning improvements for non-native participants exposed to translated material versus traditional bilingual reference sheets. These results confirm that AI-driven translation adapted to robotics contexts can eliminate cross-language barriers, enhance inclusivity, and support international collaboration in robotics programming education. The NMTRF framework is expected to serve as a foundation for building multilingual learning platforms and global robotics education ecosystems.

title: Hybrid CNN-Transformer and YOLOv8-Based Robust Real-Time Object Detection for Autonomous Vehicles
authors: Madhuri S Marri, Monica P
publish: 2025 Innovations in Power and Advanced Computing Technologies (i-PACT)
abstract: Real-time and robust object detection is a critical component of autonomous vehicle perception systems, directly impacting operational safety and decision making. This paper proposes a powerful hybrid object detection frame work that integrates a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) and a Vision Transformer (ViT) architecture with an optimized YOLOv8 detection head designed to maximize detection accuracy, adversarial resilience and deployment efficiency on edge devices. The framework employs Neural Architecture Search (NAS) for automated model optimization and incorporates SelfSupervised Learning (SSL) to enhance feature generalization in data limited environments. To further strengthen robustness, adversarial training utilizing the Fast Gradient Sign Method (FGSM) and Project Gradient Descent (PGD) is applied substantially increasing resistance to adversarial perturbations. Comprehensive evaluations on the KITTI and nuScenes datasets demonstrate that the proposed approach outperforms baseline YOLOv8 by upto 4 % in mean Average Precision (mAP), while maintaining a low inference latency of 22 ms, thus achieving real-time performance. Furthermore, the model's robustness under adversarial attacks is improved by 30 % underscoring its reliability in safety critical scenarios. These results establish the proposed architecture as a robust, scalable and highperformance solution for object detection in autonomous driving applications.

title: A Continuous Integration Framework for Machine Learning-Based Mobile Behaviour Analysis
authors: Gokulraj G, Bose S, Danya S, Maheswaran N, Pradeep Kumar M, Shruthi T
publish: 2025 Innovations in Power and Advanced Computing Technologies (i-PACT)
abstract: In today's digital era, analyzing user behaviour through mobile usage data is essential for enhancing user engagement and delivering personalized services. Integrating machine learning with DevOps practices enables automated, scalable, and real-time behaviour analysis systems. This framework employs machine learning models such as Random Forests, Decision Trees, and Neural Networks to classify user activity based on features like screen time, app usage frequency, and behavioural patterns. The models are trained on preprocessed and feature-engineered datasets to predict categories like Work-Oriented, Entertainment-Focused, or Balanced Users. The proposed system achieves high performance with accuracy exceeding 90 %, supported by precision and recall metrics that confirm its robustness in behavioural classification. Combined with Git-based version control, Jenkins-driven CI/CD, and AWS EC2 deployment, the framework ensures continuous integration, deployment, and scalability for real-time insights. It demonstrates a novel end-to-end MLOps approach that seamlessly automates model training, testing, and cloud deployment for dynamic behaviour profiling.

title: Performance Analysis of Decoder Architectures Based on Reconstruction Error in Video Surveillance
authors: Dinesh Kumar D, Chemmalar Selvi G
publish: 2025 Innovations in Power and Advanced Computing Technologies (i-PACT)
abstract: Video anomaly detection in surveillance data is a crucial task for ensuring public safety and effective monitoring. This study presents a performance comparison of five decoder architectures in the context of autoencoder-based reconstruction anomaly detection. The same encoder is used across all five decoders-ConvTranspose2D (Baseline), U-Net, AttentionAugmented, Transformer, and Multi-Scale-to ensure fair comparison. We apply the method on frames extracted from the UCF-Crime dataset, using SSIM-based keyframe selection and brightness-guided normalization as preprocessing steps. The anomaly scoring is based on the Mean Squared Error (MSE) between the reconstructed and original frames, with abnormality defined by exceeding the 95th percentile threshold. According to experimental results, the Transformer decoder achieved the lowest 95 th percentile MSE of 0.2206, followed by AttentionAugmented (0.2489), UNet (0.2644), Multi-Scale (0.2805), and Baseline (0.3167). These results validate that the decoder choice significantly influences anomaly detection performance. The study also highlights the importance of temporal consistency and spatial reasoning in designing effective reconstruction-based anomaly detection models.

title: Small Language Models in Healthcare: Capabilities, Challenges, and Future Directions
authors: Sanjeev Rao, Reyan Singh, Kanishk Jagya, Sahil Sharma
publish: 2025 Seventeenth International Conference on Contemporary Computing (IC3)
abstract: Large Language Models (LLMs) exhibit significant proficiency in various natural language processing tasks. Nonetheless, their direct implementation in healthcare is limited by significant computational expenses, concerns regarding data privacy, and restricted interpretability. In contrast, Small Language Models (SLMs), generally comprising fewer than 8 billion parameters and often less than 3 billion in clinical applications, present a more pragmatic and privacy-aware option. This paper offers an overview of SLMs in healthcare, focusing on architectural innovations, training strategies, and domain-specific adaptations that facilitate their implementation in clinical environments. This work examines healthcare applications in decision support, documentation, and patient interaction, emphasizing technical adaptations including multimodal integration and knowledge distillation. Besides, the paper summarizes risk–benefit considerations to facilitate responsible adoption and proposes an updated taxonomy that classifies models based on deployment readiness and modality support. Finally, the paper concludes by identifying significant challenges and proposing future research directions for the reliable and scalable integration of SLMs in practical healthcare settings.

title: Book Automatic Procurement Based on Knowledge Graph and Graph Neural Network
authors: Ruoxi Liu, Honghai Kan
publish: 2025 6th International Conference on Computer Engineering and Intelligent Control (ICCEIC)
abstract: This paper elaborates the design and implementation of an automatic procurement system based on knowledge graph and graph neural network in detail. Firstly, it analyzes the problems existing in traditional procurement systems, and demonstrates the necessity of constructing a new-type automatic procurement system. Subsequently, it introduces the relevant technologies of knowledge graph and graph neural network, including the construction of knowledge graph, as well as the principles and models of graph neural network. Then, it focuses on discussing the overall architecture of the automatic procurement system, and the significant effect of this system in improving procurement quality has been verified through practical cases.

title: Lightweight Facial Expression Recognition for Online Classrooms Based on MobileViT-P_CBAM
authors: Xiangyang Qiao, Zhuming Huang, Pan Liu, Mengmeng Lian
publish: 2025 6th International Conference on Computer Engineering and Intelligent Control (ICCEIC)
abstract: Facial expression recognition (FER) is essential for classroom emotion analysis; however, practical deployment requires models that are lightweight and efficient. Existing approaches often suffer from redundancy and have difficulty in recognizing subtle micro-expressions on edge devices. To address these limitations, we propose a lightweight hybrid framework that integrates MobileViT with a Parallel CBAM (P_CBAM). Unlike the conventional sequential design of CBAM, P_CBAM employs a dual-branch parallel structure to enhance feature interaction and improve gradient flow. Furthermore, a stage-wise strategy introduces P_CBAM modules into Layers 3–5 of MobileViT, progressively constructing hierarchical features from local textures to global semantics. To further enhance recognition performance, a customized loss function is designed to improve inter-class discrimination. Experimental results show recognition accuracies of 69.6% on AffectNet-35k, 84.4% on RAF-DB, and 80.3% on DIPSEER-8k, demonstrating the effectiveness of the proposed framework for lightweight FER in classroom edge scenarios.

title: Current Sharing Design of Multi-Chip SiC Power Module Based on 3D-Laminated Cu-Clip Architecture
authors: Yehui Meng, Haidong Yan, Yao Zhu, Miao Cai, Ji Cheng, Maosheng Zhang
publish: 2025 22nd China International Forum on Solid State Lighting &amp; 2025 11th International Forum on Wide Bandgap Semiconductors (SSLCHINA: IFWS)
abstract: Traditional wire bonding and die-top system (DTS) interconnect structures suffer from high parasitic parameters and low thermal efficiency, failing to meet the urgent demands of power electronics systems evolving toward higher frequencies and greater power density. Addressing the multiple challenges faced by planar interconnect structuresinsufficient current-carrying capacity alongside conflicting demands for low inductance and low current imbalance-this paper proposes a copper clip (Cu-Clip) three-dimensional topological interconnect structure. Compared to traditional aluminum wire bonding solutions, it reduces junction temperature by $17.92^{\circ} \mathrm{C}$ while decreasing resistance and stress by $30.92 \%$ and $62.64 \%$, respectively. Combined with an impedance-matched current-sharing scheme, the current imbalance between upper and lower bridge arms was optimized from $27.34 \% / 38.92 \%$ to $9.74 \% / 7.06 \%$, while total parasitic inductance was reduced to 4.37 nH. Furthermore, dual-pulse dynamic testing validated its robustness in realtime scenarios. This study provides a novel low-inductance, high-current-sharing interconnection solution for high-powerdensity power electronic devices.

title: CoEdge-RAG: Optimizing Hierarchical Scheduling for Retrieval-Augmented LLMs in Collaborative Edge Computing
authors: Guihang Hong, Tao Ouyang, Kongyange Zhao, Zhi Zhou, Xu Chen
publish: 2025 IEEE Real-Time Systems Symposium (RTSS)
abstract: Motivated by the imperative for real-time responsiveness and data privacy preservation, large language models (LLMs) are increasingly deployed on resource-constrained edge devices to enable localized inference. To improve output quality, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) is an efficient technique that seamlessly integrates local data into LLMs. However, existing edge computing paradigms primarily focus on single-node optimization, neglecting opportunities to holistically exploit distributed data and heterogeneous resources through cross-node collaboration. To bridge this gap, we propose CoEdge-RAG, a hierarchical scheduling framework for retrieval-augmented LLMs in collaborative edge computing. In general, privacy constraints preclude accurate a priori acquisition of heterogeneous data distributions across edge nodes, directly impeding RAG performance optimization. Thus, we first design an online query identification mechanism using proximal policy optimization (PPO), which autonomously infers query semantics and establishes cross-domain knowledge associations in an online manner. Second, we devise a dynamic inter-node scheduling strategy that balances workloads across heterogeneous edge nodes by synergizing historical performance analytics with real-time resource thresholds. Third, we develop an intra-node scheduler based on online convex optimization, adaptively allocating query processing ratios and memory resources to optimize the latency-quality trade-off under fluctuating assigned loads. Comprehensive evaluations across diverse QA benchmarks demonstrate that our proposed method significantly boosts the performance of collaborative retrieval-augmented LLMs, achieving performance gains of 4.23 % to 91.39% over baseline methods across all tasks.

title: Sustainable Smart Lock for Vehicle Rentals in Controlled Environment
authors: M. Vijay Sathappan, Sujatha Rajkumar, Rathish A., Sathagan S.T., Mau-Luen Tham
publish: 2025 Innovations in Power and Advanced Computing Technologies (i-PACT)
abstract: Early smart mobility solutions require secure, automatic, and optimized systems adapted for localized settings like university campuses and urban areas. This paper introduces LockX, a sophisticated electronic locking mechanism designed to facilitate real-time anti-theft surveillance, accident identification, and smart analytics for secure and hassle-free bicycle rentals. The LockX system employs an electronic lock powered by a servo motor, controlled by an ESP32-based Internet of Things (IoT) module and RFID-based passive authentication to limit access to authorized persons only. Security and theft protection are enhanced through the addition of an accelerometer and vibration sensor, with instantaneous alerts sent via an internal WiFi module. The user interface is created with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for the front-end, and Zoho Creator, a cloud platform, for building the backend, which manages user identification, rentals, and analytics. Zoho APIs are used to enable real-time synchronization among hardware and software components for autonomous operation of rentals and usage monitoring. LockX is additionally integrated with solar-powered energy-efficient technology, low-power parts, and data-based optimizations toward sustainable development goals. The system proposed not only ensures strong vehicle security and user authentication but also serves as a smart mobility paradigm scalable to eco-friendly transportation in controlled environments.

title: Review on Hardware Accelerator Hardware Software Co-Design for Machine Learning
authors: VedanthSrivatson A, Sivanantham Sathasivam, Prakash Ramachandran
publish: 2025 Innovations in Power and Advanced Computing Technologies (i-PACT)
abstract: In recent years, the fast expansion of advanced models of machine learning (ML) and deep learning (DL) has necessitated computing platforms that are not only high-performance but also energy-efficient and adaptable. This review explores developments from 2020 to 2025 in hardware-software co-design (HW/SW co-design) strategies, which enable integration between hardware accelerators and software components. The paper systematically categorizes codesign approaches based on ML methodologies, target platforms, and application domains, highlighting key performance metrics such as throughput, energy efficiency, latency, and accuracy. Through an in-depth analysis of frameworks like RSNN, TinyM2Net-V2, and CODEBench, and toolchains such as Vivado HLS, TVM, and TensorFlow Lite, the review showcases their application in edge AI, computer vision, scientific computing, and secure processing. Quantitative comparisons reveal that FPGA-based designs achieve an optimal balance between performance and power efficiency, outperforming GPUs and ASICs in several energy-constrained scenarios. Challenges such as partitioning complexity, fragmented toolchains, and limited automation are discussed alongside trends in dynamic partial reconfiguration, AI-driven toolchains, and RISC-V-based SoCs. Future research directions emphasize the need for unified frameworks, support for complex models and hardware-aware optimization techniques. This review concludes that hardware/software co-design is essential for enabling scalable, low-power, real-time ML systems, offering a promising pathway toward next-generation intelligent edge computing and high-performance embedded systems.

title: A Hybrid CNN-LSTM Architecture for Multiclass Intrusion Detection in IoT Networks
authors: Mehdi Moucharraf, Mohammed Ridouani, Fatima Salahdine, Naima Kaabouch
publish: 2025 12th International Conference on Wireless Networks and Mobile Communications (WINCOM)
abstract: As cyber threats against Internet of Things (IoT) environments have become more diverse and complex. Therefore, there is increased demand for accurate and intelligent Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS). Conventional machine learning techniques fall short in defining the inherent spatial-temporal patterns typically found in network traffic. This paper introduces a hybrid deep learning methodology that integrates one-dimensional Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN) with Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) layers to perform multiclass learning. The model was trained and assessed using the UNSW-NB15 dataset, which includes a variety of attacks. The preprocessing pipeline was comprehensive and covered missing value handling, categorical encoding, feature scaling, and categorical label transformation. The input data, once reshaped through a preprocessing pipeline, was fed to a stacked CNNLSTM architecture for local feature representation learning and sequential dependence learning. The model produced a test score of 97.81% for accuracy, 98.97% precision, and 97.00% recall when identifying both common and complex attack categories. Given the model has relatively few trainable parameters, it can deliver a high performance whilst remaining computationally efficient - the ability to use the CNN-LSTM architecture could enable the deployment of security solutions in real-time for IoT security frameworks.

title: Application of Multi Pulse Millimeter Wave Radar Combined with Remote Robot Vision Monitoring System in Flood Control
authors: Shulan Li
publish: 2025 6th International Conference on Computer Engineering and Intelligent Control (ICCEIC)
abstract: This paper studies the application of multi pulse millimeter wave radar combined with remote robot vision monitoring system in flood control. The system consists of gyroscope, control board, lidar, encoder, camera, industrial computer, remote control computer and router. The vision positioning system improves the positioning accuracy of the robot by processing the camera image. This paper proposes a particle filter SLAM algorithm based on least square matching. The core of SLAM algorithm is to obtain the robot position through least square matching in each iteration, expand the particle set and optimize the particle set distribution. After the fusion of visual images and lidar data, when the distance is fixed, the larger the gray value of the fusion data is. The camera and 3D lidar are used to fuse the target detection results to improve the effectiveness of target detection. In the visualization part, the GIS platform component library and model components are combined, and the flood inundation data set is output. The process of flood dynamic evolution is formed on the basis of topographic data. The development process and development trend of inundation range are calculated, and the flood inundation information is mastered to reduce flood loss.

title: Traffic Analysis and Optimization Strategies for IP Backbone Network
authors: Xuan Wei, Wenyun Li, Xiaoming He, Huahong Zhu
publish: 2025 6th International Conference on Computer Engineering and Intelligent Control (ICCEIC)
abstract: Traffic analysis and optimization for IP backbone network are critical tasks in network operations and performance management. The primary objectives are to identify traffic patterns, detect abnormal behaviors, optimize resource allocation, and enhance network operation efficiency and quality. This study analyzes the current status of inter-provincial traffic in China Telecom’s IP backbone network, summarizing the main characteristics of traffic distribution. The results indicate that while inter-provincial flows exhibit strong localization characteristics, significant room for optimization remains. Furthermore, traffic imbalance and localized congestion are observed in certain directions and links.
